content: eclair cake by veronica parsons growing up a fun favorite summer dessert was a no-bake chocolate eclair cake with layers of graham crackers and vanilla pudding it wasn t necessarily a culinary masterpiece but it was always a treat sweet and simple eclair cake is a little knitting treat in two colors of fingering weight cashmere-silk yarn build up layers of stripes in an easy stitch pattern for a cowl that will nestle softly around your neck eclair cake yarn miss babs sojourn 65% cashmere 35% silk 200 yd/1 8 oz 183 m / 50 g skeins one skein each of two colors shown in coastal fog color a and gibson girl color b or approximately 200 yards/180 meters of each of two colors of fingering weight yarn finished measurements abbreviations circumference 20 /50 cm height 14½ /36 cm k knit needles p purl us 3 3 25 mm circular needles 16 /40 cm long or yo yarn over 1 stitch increased size to obtain gauge * * stitch pattern repeat gauge unblocked 34 stitches and 40 rounds = 4 /10 cm over stitch pattern blocked 32 stitches and 38 rounds = 4 /10 cm over stitch pattern gauge is not crucial for this project but will affect yardage and finished size if different from above notions stitch marker tapestry needle © veronica parsons 2021 for pattern support email veronica knits@gmail com page 2 of 3 eclair cake notes slip all stitches purlwise carry unused color loosely up the inside of the work catching it every few rounds you may change the stripe pattern as desired change colors at the beginning of any round 1 of stitch pattern you may change the circumference of the cowl as desired cast on any multiple of 4 stitches cowl next round break color b switch to color a and work with color a cast on 156 stitches join to work in the round 1 of stitch pattern round being careful not to twist and mark beginning of next round with color a work round 2 of stitch round pattern work 5 rounds of k1 p1 ribbing work 6 rounds of k1 p1 ribbing bind off loosely in pattern next round knit to end do not break color a finishing next round switch to color b and knit to end weave in ends and block gently to even out stitches begin stitch pattern round 1 *slip 1 k3 pass slipped stitch over 3 stitches just knit repeat from * to end round 2 *yo k3 repeat from * to end round 3 knit to end round 4 knit to end repeat rounds 1-4 for stitch pattern *work 3 repeats of stitch pattern in color b alternated with 3 repeats in color a to form 12-round stripes repeat from * four more times work 3 repeats in color b cowl shown has 6 stripes in color b and 5 stripes in color a © veronica
